Package edu.kit.kastel.mcse.ardoco.core.common.util.wordsim.vector

Class WordVectorSqliteImporter

java.lang.Object
edu.kit.kastel.mcse.ardoco.core.common.util.wordsim.vector.WordVectorSqliteImporter
public class WordVectorSqliteImporter extends Object
Reads a file containing word vector embeddings and inserts them into a sqlite database.

The database must contain a table called words with two columns: word and vec. The word column must be a TEXT column while the vec column must be a BLOB. Vector representations will be inserted as a consecutive sequence of floats. The amount of floats in a sequence depends on the dimension of the vectors.

This class can be customized by extending it and overriding the processWord(String) and filterWord(String) methods. Both methods are called for each word and allow filtering/modifying words before they are inserted into the databse.

  • Constructor Details

    • WordVectorSqliteImporter

      public WordVectorSqliteImporter(Path vectorFile, Path dbFile, int dimension)
      Constructs a new WordVectorSqliteImporter instance.
      Parameters:
      vectorFile - the path to the file that contains the vector representations for each word
      dbFile - the path to the sqlite database into which the vector representations will be inserted
      dimension - the dimension of the vectors

    • WordVectorSqliteImporter

      public WordVectorSqliteImporter(Path vectorFile, Path dbFile, int dimension, int maxWordLength, long startLine, long endLine, boolean dryRun)
      Constructs a new WordVectorSqliteImporter instance. To start the import process, call beginImport().
      Parameters:
      vectorFile - the path ot the file that contains the vector representations for each word
      dbFile - the path to the sqlite database into which the vector representations will be inserted
      dimension - the dimension of the vectors
      maxWordLength - the maximum length a word is allowed to have to be inserted into the database
      startLine - at which line of the vectorFile this importer will start inserting
      endLine - at which line of the vectorFile this importer will stop inserting
      dryRun - whether this importer should actually insert. Use false to run this importer without actually inserting anything

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws SQLException, IOException
      Launches an import process. The first string in the args array must be the path to the file containing the vector representations. The second string in the args array must be the path to the sqlite database file. The third string in the args array must be the dimension of the vectors.
      Parameters:
      args - the args array
      Throws:
      IOException - if an io error occurs
      SQLException - if a database related error occurs

    • beginImport

      public edu.kit.kastel.mcse.ardoco.core.common.util.wordsim.vector.WordVectorSqliteImporter.ImportResult beginImport() throws SQLException, IOException, IllegalStateException
      Starts the import process.
      Returns:
      the result of the import process
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while interacting with the database
      IOException - if an error occurs while interacting with the vector file
      IllegalStateException - if a vector with an invalid dimension is found

    • processWord

      protected String processWord(String word)
      This method is called for each word that is read from the vector file. The string that is returned will then be used for insertion.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to process
      Returns:
      the processed version of the word

    • filterWord

      protected boolean filterWord(String word)
      This method is called for each word that is read from the vector file. It allows filtering which words are inserted into database and which words are skipped.
      Parameters:
      word - the word
      Returns:
      returns true if the should should be inserted into the database, false if not.
